page.title: 05Torbay Hunter and Pony Feeds
page.content: We went to Torbay Hunter and Pony Feeds. They have 73 acres of land of which 12 are rented to them. They have eight horses on livery and two of their own. They also have a few sheep, a heifer cow in calf and a pig. Their shop used to be a farrowing shed. For agricultural equipment they have two tractors, a combine, a fertiliser spreader, a baler, a front loader and an elevator. They deliver to the door. Nearly all of their trade is local. They make an adequate living and enjoy running the business. They sell their produce in the shop and the sheep in Newton Abbot market. They store their supplies in a shed and the shop. This business started as a farm and they sold feed to their friends and gradually the food became more important than the farm.
